title: How to Take Great Product Photos
description:
Professional Photos Sell More
Great photos make your listings stand out and build buyer confidence.
Equipment You Need

  Smartphone camera (newest models work great)
content:
Professional Photos Sell More

Great photos make your listings stand out and build buyer confidence.

Equipment You Need

  • Smartphone camera (newest models work great)
  • Clean white background (poster board works)
  • Natural daylight or bright lamps
  • Tripod or stable surface (optional)

Lighting Setup

  • Best: Shoot near window with indirect sunlight
  • Avoid direct harsh sunlight
  • Use lamps if needed (daylight-balanced bulbs)
  • Eliminate shadows with lights from multiple angles

Photo Composition

  1. Main Photo: Full item on white background, slightly angled
  2. Detail Shots: Close-ups of important features
  3. Scale Photo: Show size with common object (coin, ruler)
  4. All Angles: Front, back, sides, top, bottom
  5. In Use (if applicable): Show item being used
  6. Packaging: Show what's included
  7. Defects: Clearly show any wear or damage

Camera Settings

  • Use highest resolution
  • Enable HDR mode
  • Turn off flash (use natural light instead)
  • Focus on the item (tap to focus on phone)
  • Keep camera steady

Editing Tips

  • Crop to remove excess background
  • Adjust brightness slightly if needed
  • Enhance colors slightly (don't overdo it)
  • Straighten if tilted
  • Don't use filters that misrepresent item

What NOT to Do

  • Don't use stock photos (violates policy)
  • Don't use blurry or dark photos
  • Don't hide defects
  • Don't include watermarks
  • Don't add text over photos

title: How to Open and Resolve a Dispute
description:
Resolve Transaction Problems
If something goes wrong with a transaction, the dispute system helps resolve it fairly.
When to Open a Dispute

  Item never arrived
content:
Resolve Transaction Problems

If something goes wrong with a transaction, the dispute system helps resolve it fairly.

When to Open a Dispute

  • Item never arrived
  • Item significantly different from description
  • Item damaged in shipping
  • Wrong item received
  • Seller unresponsive after payment

Step 1: Try to Resolve Directly

Message the seller first. Many issues can be resolved through communication.

Step 2: Open Dispute

If the seller doesn't respond or won't resolve, go to your order and click "Open Dispute."

Step 3: Provide Evidence

  • Upload photos of the item/problem
  • Include tracking information
  • Copy of product description
  • Screenshots of messages with seller
  • Any other relevant evidence

Step 4: Seller Response

The seller has 48 hours to respond with their side of the story and evidence.

Step 5: Arbitrator Review

An independent arbitrator reviews both sides. They may ask follow-up questions.

Step 6: Decision

Within 5-7 days, the arbitrator issues a binding decision:

  • Full refund to buyer
  • Partial refund
  • No refund (favor seller)
  • Split decision

Step 7: Automatic Execution

The smart contract automatically executes the decision. No one can override it.

title: How to Handle Returns
description:
Process Returns Professionally
Handling returns well builds your reputation and encourages future sales.
When a Return Request Comes In

  You'll receive a notificati
content:
Process Returns Professionally

Handling returns well builds your reputation and encourages future sales.

When a Return Request Comes In

  1. You'll receive a notification
  2. Go to your seller dashboard
  3. Click on the return request
  4. Read the buyer's reason
  5. Review any photos they provided

Your Options

  • Approve: Accept the return as requested
  • Partial Refund: Offer partial refund to keep item
  • Replacement: Offer to send a replacement
  • Decline: Deny return with explanation

Approval Process

If you approve the return:

  1. Click "Approve Return"
  2. Specify who pays return shipping
  3. Provide return address
  4. Set deadline for return (usually 14 days)
  5. Buyer ships item back with tracking

Receiving the Return

  1. Inspect returned item carefully
  2. Take photos of condition
  3. Compare to original condition
  4. Check if all parts are included

Issuing Refund

If item is acceptable:

  1. Click "Issue Refund"
  2. Enter refund amount
  3. Deduct return shipping if policy allows
  4. Deduct restocking fee if applicable
  5. Confirm refund
  6. Buyer receives refund within 1-3 business days

If Return Item Is Damaged

  • Document with photos
  • Contact buyer immediately
  • Offer partial refund
  • If dispute can't be resolved, open arbitration

Best Practices

  • Respond to return requests within 24 hours
  • Be professional and courteous
  • Try to resolve without arbitration
  • Learn from returns to improve listings
  • Update descriptions if same issue occurs multiple times

description:

content:
Complete Transaction Privacy

Convert XOM to pXOM for untraceable transactions.

Step 1: Open Privacy Converter

In your wallet, click "Privacy" tab, then "Convert to pXOM"

Step 2: Enter Amount

Enter how much XOM you want to convert to private pXOM. The 0.3% conversion fee is shown.

Step 3: Confirm Conversion

Review the details and click "Convert". Confirm in your wallet.

Step 4: Wait for Confirmation

Conversion usually takes 10-30 seconds. Your pXOM balance will update.

Step 5: Use pXOM

Send pXOM just like regular XOM:

  • Click "Send"
  • Select pXOM from token dropdown
  • Enter recipient address
  • Enter amount
  • Send

Privacy Features

pXOM transactions hide:

  • Transaction amounts
  • Sender address
  • Receiver address
  • Transaction history links

Converting Back to XOM

When you need transparent XOM:

  1. Click "Convert to XOM"
  2. Enter pXOM amount
  3. Pay 0.3% fee
  4. Receive XOM

When to Use pXOM

  • Large transactions you want private
  • Business payments
  • Salary payments
  • Protecting personal financial privacy

When NOT to Use pXOM

  • Marketplace purchases (XOM required)
  • Staking (requires transparent XOM)
  • DEX trading (most pairs require XOM)
  • Validator operations

Legal Notice

pXOM is for legitimate privacy protection. Do not use for illegal activities. You're responsible for complying with your local laws.

title: IPFS Distributed Storage
description:
Distributed Storage with IPFS
OmniBazaar uses IPFS (InterPlanetary File System) to store your marketplace listings, keeping data distributed and censorship-resistant.
What is IPFS
content:
Distributed Storage with IPFS

OmniBazaar uses IPFS (InterPlanetary File System) to store your marketplace listings, keeping data distributed and censorship-resistant.

What is IPFS?

IPFS is a peer-to-peer network for storing and sharing data. Unlike centralized servers, your content is distributed across many nodes worldwide.

Benefits for Users

  • Your listings load fast from nearby nodes
  • No single point of failure
  • Censorship-resistant content
  • Lower costs than centralized hosting

How It Works

When you create a listing, your photos and description are uploaded to IPFS. Multiple validators store copies, ensuring your content stays available even if some nodes go offline.

title: How to Bridge Tokens Between Chains
description:
Move Assets Between Blockchains
Use bridges to transfer tokens from one blockchain to another.
Step 1: Access Bridge
In your wallet, click "Bridge" tab
Step 2: Sel
content:
Move Assets Between Blockchains

Use bridges to transfer tokens from one blockchain to another.

Step 1: Access Bridge

In your wallet, click "Bridge" tab

Step 2: Select Route

Choose:

  • Source Chain: Where your tokens are now
  • Destination Chain: Where you want them
  • Token: What you're bridging

Step 3: Check Route Details

Review:

  • Bridge fee (usually 0.1-0.3%)
  • Estimated time (5-20 minutes typically)
  • Minimum/maximum amounts
  • Gas fees on both chains

Step 4: Enter Amount

Enter how much you want to bridge. Calculator shows you'll receive on destination chain (after fees).

Step 5: Approve Token

First transaction: Approve the bridge contract to spend your tokens. Confirm in wallet.

Step 6: Start Bridge

Second transaction: Actually bridge the tokens. Confirm in wallet.

Step 7: Wait for Confirmations

Your tokens are:

  1. Locked on source chain (wait for confirmations)
  2. Verified by bridge validators
  3. Minted on destination chain
  4. Sent to your address

Step 8: Verify Receipt

Check your wallet on destination chain. Tokens should arrive in 5-20 minutes.

Common Routes

  • Ethereum → Polygon (cheap, fast)
  • Ethereum → Arbitrum (very cheap)
  • BSC → Polygon
  • Avalanche → Ethereum

Troubleshooting

If tokens don't arrive:

  1. Check bridge status page
  2. Verify transaction on source chain explorer
  3. Wait full estimated time
  4. Add destination token to wallet (might not show automatically)
  5. Contact bridge support if still missing after 1 hour

OmniBazaar settles transactions on the Avalanche blockchain with 1-2 second finality, making trades nearly instant.
Settlement Process

  Your
content:
How Transactions Settle

OmniBazaar settles transactions on the Avalanche blockchain with 1-2 second finality, making trades nearly instant.

Settlement Process

  1. Your trade is matched off-chain for speed
  2. Settlement batch is created every 2 seconds
  3. Batch is submitted to blockchain
  4. Consensus is reached via Snowman protocol
  5. Your funds are transferred

Why This Matters

Fast settlement means you can trade confidently, knowing your transactions will complete quickly and securely.

title: How to Stay Safe Online
description:
Protect Yourself from Scams
Learn to recognize and avoid common crypto and marketplace scams.
Common Scams to Watch For

1. Phishing Websites

  <
content:
Protect Yourself from Scams

Learn to recognize and avoid common crypto and marketplace scams.

Common Scams to Watch For

1. Phishing Websites

  • Fake websites that look like OmniBazaar
  • Steal your password or recovery phrase
  • Prevention: Always check URL is correct

2. Fake Support

  • Scammers pretending to be OmniBazaar support
  • Ask for your recovery phrase or password
  • Prevention: Real support NEVER asks for these

3. Too Good to Be True

  • Items priced far below market value
  • Seller asks for payment outside platform
  • Prevention: Always use OmniBazaar payment system

4. Advance Fee Fraud

  • "Pay small fee to receive large reward"
  • Fake lottery winnings, unclaimed funds, etc.
  • Prevention: No legitimate service asks for fees upfront

5. Impersonation

  • Scammers using photos/descriptions from real listings
  • Pretending to be known sellers
  • Prevention: Check seller ratings and history

Red Flags

  • Urgency ("act now or miss out!")
  • Requests to move conversation off-platform
  • Unwilling to use escrow
  • Poor grammar and spelling
  • New account with no history
  • Requests for gift cards or wire transfers

Safe Trading Practices

  • Use escrow for high-value items
  • Keep all communication on OmniBazaar
  • Verify seller's rating and history
  • Ask questions before buying
  • Get additional photos if needed
  • Use tracking for all shipments
  • Document everything

Wallet Security

  • Never share recovery phrase with anyone
  • Use hardware wallet for large amounts
  • Enable all security features (2FA, biometric)
  • Don't click suspicious links
  • Verify transaction details before confirming

If You Suspect a Scam

  1. Don't proceed with transaction
  2. Take screenshots
  3. Report to OmniBazaar
  4. Warn other users if appropriate
  5. Contact authorities if money was lost

Recovery

If you fall victim to a scam:

  • Report immediately
  • Change passwords
  • Open dispute if within platform
  • File police report for large losses
  • Learn from experience

content:
Protect Your Trades with Stop-Loss

Stop-loss orders automatically sell your position if the price drops, limiting your losses.

Step 1: Open the DEX

Go to DEX > Trading and select your trading pair.

Step 2: Select Stop-Loss Order Type

Click on the order type dropdown and choose "Stop-Loss" or "Stop-Limit"

Enter the price at which you want the order to trigger. For example, if you bought at $100 and want to limit loss to 10%, set stop at $90.

Enter how much you want to sell when triggered (can be your full position or partial).

Click "Place Stop-Loss Order" and confirm in your wallet.

If price drops to your stop price:

  • Stop-Loss: Sells immediately at market price
  • Stop-Limit: Places a limit order at your specified price

Pro Tips

  • Set stop-loss 5-10% below entry price
  • Don't set it too tight (normal volatility might trigger it)
  • Adjust stop-loss as price moves in your favor
  • Consider using trailing stop-loss for trending markets

title: How to Write Effective Descriptions
description:
Descriptions That Sell
A great description answers all buyer questions and builds confidence.
Structure Your Description

  Opening: One-sentence sum
content:
Descriptions That Sell

A great description answers all buyer questions and builds confidence.

Structure Your Description

  1. Opening: One-sentence summary of the item
  2. Key Features: Bullet list of main features
  3. Detailed Description: Full details
  4. Condition Report: Honest condition assessment
  5. What's Included: List everything in the sale
  6. Shipping Info: Handling time and methods
  7. Return Policy: Your return policy

Key Features Section

Use bullet points for easy scanning:

  • Brand and model
  • Main specifications
  • Key benefits
  • Unique selling points
  • Condition summary

Detailed Description

Write 2-3 paragraphs covering:

  • What the item is and what it does
  • Why it's great (features and benefits)
  • Your experience with it
  • Why you're selling
  • Any relevant history

Condition Report

Be extremely honest:

  • Use standard terms (New, Like New, Used-Excellent, Used-Good, Used-Fair)
  • Describe any wear, scratches, or defects
  • Note if anything doesn't work
  • Mention if parts are missing
  • Refer to photos for visual proof

Writing Style Tips

  • Write in clear, simple language
  • Use short sentences and paragraphs
  • Be enthusiastic but honest
  • Use active voice
  • Proofread for typos
  • Format with bullet points and spacing

SEO Keywords

Naturally include terms buyers might search:

  • Brand names
  • Model numbers
  • Product types
  • Common misspellings
  • Compatible items

What to Avoid

  • Don't use ALL CAPS (looks spammy)
  • Don't exaggerate or lie
  • Don't include contact info (use messaging)
  • Don't copy manufacturer descriptions verbatim
  • Don't write in all lowercase

description:

content:
Earn Fees as a Liquidity Provider

Provide liquidity to earn a share of trading fees.

Step 1: Choose a Trading Pair

Go to DEX > Liquidity Pools and browse available pairs. Check the current APR.

Step 2: Check Requirements

You'll need equal values of both tokens. For example, for XOM/USDC pool, you need $500 of XOM and $500 of USDC.

Step 3: Add Liquidity

  1. Click "Add Liquidity"
  2. Enter amount of first token
  3. Amount of second token is calculated automatically
  4. Review the transaction
  5. Click "Supply"
  6. Confirm in your wallet

Step 4: Receive LP Tokens

You'll receive LP (Liquidity Provider) tokens representing your share of the pool.

Step 5: Earn Fees

You now earn a portion of every trade in that pair! Fees compound automatically.

Step 6: Monitor Your Position

Check your liquidity dashboard to see accumulated fees and current value.

Step 7: Remove Liquidity

When ready to withdraw:

  1. Go to your liquidity positions
  2. Click "Remove"
  3. Choose how much to remove (partial or full)
  4. Confirm transaction
  5. You'll receive both tokens back plus earned fees

Understanding Impermanent Loss

If token prices diverge significantly, you might have less value than if you'd just held. The trading fees usually compensate for this.
